questions: What was the main aim of revolutionaries of Europe during the years following 1815 ?
answers: To oppose monarchial forms of government.

questions: What was the meaning of liberalism in early nineteenth century in Europe ?
answers: Liberalism stood for freedom for individual and equality for all before the laws.

questions: What was the main aim of Treaty of Vienna 1815 ?
answers: Undoing most of the changes that had come about in Europe.

questions: What was the major change that occurred in the political and constitutional scenario due to French Revolution in Europe ?
answers: The French Revolution led to the transfer of sovereignty from the monarchy to a body of French citizen.

questions: What was the main aim of the French Revolutionaries ?
answers: The main aim of French Revolutionaries was to create a sense of collective identity amongst the French people.

questions: What was the major issue taken up by the liberal nationalists ?
answers: Freedom of the Press.

questions: What is meant by Nation State?
answers: When people living in a particular region develop an identity, with definite boundary, common ruler and common culture, it is called as Nation State. 1

questions: What is meant by Nationalism?
answers: Nationalism is the love and patriotic feeling for ones own country.

questions: Which revolution was the first clear expression of nationalism?
answers: It was the French Revolution, which was started in the year 1789. It marked the transfer of power from monarch to a body of French citizen.

questions: Name the areas occupied by the French armies under Napoleon.
answers: Holland, Belgium and Switzerland.

questions: Who comprised of the new middle-class?
answers: Industrialists, Businessmen and Professionals.

questions: How did the artists of the time of the French Revolution personified Liberty?
answers: The artists of the time of the French Revolution personified Liberty as a female figure.

questions: What was Sorrieu’s utopian vision?
answers: In Sorrieu’s utopian vision, the people of the world are grouped as distinct nations, identified through their flags and national costume.

questions: When did Napoleonic war begin?
answers: The Napoleonic war began in 1797 when Napoleon invaded Italy.

questions: When was Vienna Peace Settlement signed?
answers: The Vienna Peace Settlement was signed in 18141815 after the fall of Napoleon.

questions: What does La Patrie mean?
answers: The Fatherland.

questions: Which country is known as the cradle of civilisation?
answers: Greece is known as the cradle of civilisation.

questions: The basic aim of Zollverein was ____ (to abolish tariff barriers/to reunite Germany).
answers: To abolish tariff barriers.

answers: States were :  Bulgaria,  Greece and  Romania.
